Instrument.name: Propulsion Subsystem
Instrument.description: Propulsion is provided by a pressurized mono-propellant system based on ultrapure hydrazine. The system includes a main propellant tank, a helium pressurant tank, four 200-N main thrusters for the largest maneuvers, six 22-N thrusters for trajectory corrections, sixteen 4.5-N thrusters for attitude control, and two 0.5-N thrusters for precise maneuvers needed prior to departure from Bennu orbit and for touch-and-go sample acquisition. Thruster activity is recorded for transmission to Earth in the spacecraft engineering data stream.
